dialogues.text: Exits. His paranoia feeding Emily's. In the hush she hear that faint CYCLICAL SQUEAKING. Looks across the darkened office to her cubicle where Lucy is turning circles in he chair again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That face. That face. That face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense dinner. Emily barely touching hers. Lucy, absently, but with an almost surgical precision, is CUTTING PEAS IN

dialogues.speaker: HALF ON HER PLATE AND EATING THEM ONE BY ONE OFF THE TIP
dialogues.text: THE KNIFE. Weird. She stops, self-conscious, looks at Emi across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just tired. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to brush your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will make you feel better. I'll get the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stares at Emily for a moment then sits again. And it strange, her posture seems subtly different, stiffer, bon as if all her muscles have drawn taut under her clothes. a voice at once innocent and menacing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug said something, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Doug? He says you're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stares at her, seeing through the facade. Then, oddl bright, taking a bite of food:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY SILHOUETTED in the doorway, keeping her distance as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to kiss me goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense pause then Emily walks over and kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy clutches her wrist as she turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, trapped, forces a tender smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's EYES GLEAM in the darkness. She turns onto her sid for sleep, but those eyes don't shut even after Emily has walked out and closed the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football highlights on a liquid plasma tv. Doug flipping through a DSM IV diagnostic manual. The phone RINGS. He picks up, distracted, scanning the DSM index.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange INTERMITTENT STATIC BUZZ on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BZZZZT. BZZZZT. BZZZZT. A telecommunications glitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Finds the chapter he's looking for. ANTI- SOCIAL PERSONALITY TYPE. But he hears it again now -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BZZZZZZZZT BZZZZZZZZZT - louder, deeper - and realizes, i quiet terror, that it's coming from INSIDE HIS EAR. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug opens the medicine cabinet and grabs a Q-tip. Wiggle it around in his ear and when he takes it out there's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting on the cottony tip, scissoring its wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug stares in disbelief. Mouth gaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the Q-tip in the toilet. Hits the flush lever. Watches the hornet spiral away. Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares at the empty bowl. Did I just imagine that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaken, he turns to the sink. Wedges his head under the t and runs water into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straightens and looks at himself in the mirror, toweling face, trying to impose rational thought on the situation. But as the water spills from his ear, down his neck, onto shirt, it brings with it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MORE LIVE HORNETS, half drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a yelp Doug swipes them from his shirt. Crushes them underfoot. Terrified, but clinging to rational thought a moment longer, he turns his head sideways to the mirror, parts his hair, and sees -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER HORNET crawl from the ear canal, followed by SIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rationality goes out the window. He flails at them with t towel. Swats them dead. Picks them up and drops them in t toilet. Studies the last one for a moment. Its little leg twitching. Drops it in. Flushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A false respite. And a brief one. Because as the FLUSHING NOISE FADES he can hear an ominous DEEP BUZZING SOUND RIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from behind him. He turns to have a look. Nothing there. Bare wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's strange: the BUZZING IS STILL BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With dawning horror Doug turns and checks his back in the mirror, sees 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whimpering like a child, he undoes the buttons of his shi taking it off as delicately as possible. Slipping his arm gently from the sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding it by the collar, he takes two quick steps and to it in the shower. Slams the glass door, seals the crack w towels. And watches the hornets fly around in the glass enclosure, BUZZING FURIOUSLY, bouncing off the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he backpedals he realizes the FURIOUS BUZZING is t close, too loud and too deep, to be coming from the showe over there. A sharp pain in his head confirms it. He GROA and brings a hand to his ear as something awful happens inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUZZING in his right ear spreads to his left - LOUDER ANGRIER, its sources multiplying. Disoriented, he stumble backwards with an AGONIZING SCREAM. Catches sight of hims in the mirror, the terror of the moment on his face. This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the nightmare takes a devilish turn. Looking at himself in the mirror, he sees -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug grabs his head in both hands and starts shaking it, trying to shake away the madness inside. But the hornets keep coming, COUGHED UP IN CLUMPS as he gasps for air. They're all over him, stinging his tongue, his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes berserk and starts SMASHING HIS HEAD against the wall, the door, the edge of the sink, anything he can fin opening a deep gash in his forehead, smashing it harder a harder because the BUZZING WON'T STOP, cracking his skull SCREAMING HYSTERICALLY, pitching his head violently forwa and backwards like some demon-possessed heavy metal fanat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a grotesque display that ends on a sickening note wh with one particularly violent head jerk, he snaps his own neck - CRACK!!! He sinks to the floor, head askew, astonished look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there he sits, paralyzed, eyes locked on the tv in th living room where football highlights play in silence. Fu conscious as the hornets fight their way back into his ea nose, and mouth - a pilgrimage back to the mind that bore them. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily exits a counseling room. Says goodbye to a young

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and comes down the hall toward the common area. A cowor stands from an adjacent cubicle. DENISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen Doug? He had an appointment with one of my kids this morning, never showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try calling him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I get is voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily dials Doug on a fax/phone by the Xerox machine. On

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is Doug, here it comes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. She hangs up. A dark thought sends her toward the exit, calling back to Denise -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily knocking on the door of his Marina Del Rey townhous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, it's me, it's Emily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes down the steps to his car, walks past it and th stops, noticing the window is open a crack. Slipping her hand inside, stretching, she extends one finger just far enough to push the button on the garage door remote clipp to the sunvisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the drive, the door starts to open. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door in the first-floor hallway opens. Emily steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. She comes up the stairs into the LIVING ROOM. The tv is still on. Muted. Calls up the next flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply. She goes up the stairs and down the hall and checks the BEDROOM. Empty. The bed unmade. It's when she turns from the room to go back downstairs that she sees h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With stoic grief Emily walks down the cold, fluorescently corridor, intercepts a CORONER as he exits the exam room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Johannsen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her; pale, bespectacled, a bit standoffish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the autopsy on Doug Winters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to remember) Winters -- oh, right, Douglas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend. (preempting his reply) I know the rules -- please, he meant a lot to me. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face the proof. He indicates his adjoining office. Th go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the autopsy report from a filing cabinet. Review his findings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compression fracture of the third and forth vertebrae. Severed his spinal cord. Actual cause of death was... suffocation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying he did that to himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears all his injuries were self- inflicted, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. He looked like he'd been beaten to death! Don't tell me he was some - some suicidal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I knew him! He was my best friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss, I would never presume to know your friend better than you. But the injuries suggest he was trying to hurt himself. Unfortunately, he succeeded. I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, composing herself, gives a quiet nod. She has no quarrel with this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen this before, somebody dying like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner files the report, world weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truly, I am shocked every day by the violence people do to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUGLAS J. WINTERS etched in granite. A final prayer read by a PRIEST as he is laid to rest. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breeze ruffles the clothes of the MOURNERS. Blows hair across Emily's haunted face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, at her side, sees her grief and reaches for her han Instinctively, Emily retracts it. Lucy registers the slig the wider implications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily watches the coffin descend. She weeps openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, red-eyed, driving home, sees something in her peripheral vision that sends a chill through her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, gazing quietly out the passenger-side window, is SWINGING HER LEGS in that contented way children do. A sm but telling detail. Immediately HER LEGS STOP SWINGING, sensing Emily's stare. And with her head still turned awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's my fault, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face Emily, who measures her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident. It was nobody's fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy holds her gaze. Then, as if to test her, reaches aga for Emily's hand. Trapped in the lie, Emily has to let he And as she drives on in that private hell, holding hands Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, an emotional wreck, confides in Barron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was scared. He came out of that room with her, Mike, and he was scared. He said she threatened him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. You're still in shock. Let's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego said it was a man on the phone. You know who made that call. There was no one else in the house. (off his look) You think I don't know how crazy this sounds?! 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know, all I'm saying is a kid in his state of mind maybe isn't the most reliable witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he in that state of mind? Why was Doug? Pull my phone records. See if she called him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily. I already did. There were no calls from your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily's argument collapses. She sits there for a moment, vexed, her intellect telling her one thing, her gut anoth She gets up to go. Pauses at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother and father, their bedroom door has these deadbolts on it, big ones, two of `em... Something came through that door and they didn't want it ever coming through there again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily digs through her in-box, spilling things on the flo Finds the manila envelope Doug gave her. Rips it open. Dumps the contents into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typed on the label: Sheridan, Marg. & Ed., Prelim. Ps Interviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A TELEVISION - Margaret Sheridan sits facing the camer responding to the questions of an unseen interviewer. Her haunted face and frank tone make the interview chilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by forcing your daughter into the oven, can you tell me, what did you think the outcome would be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean what were we doing it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling back, we see Emily alone in a dimmed conference r watching the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why was it God's will that you should kill your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie smile comes to Margaret's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that funny, Margaret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause she's not my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're her mother...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bore her, but she's not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me understand. If you and Edward are Lucy's biological parents, how can she not be yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause she's not Of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she Of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not who, what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she Of? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop acting like you don't know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares at him. Her eyes black and unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your daughter is the devil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not him himself, Of him, working in his name, in his honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil incarnate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I think it's what I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this? Could you give me an example?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret pauses. Seeming afraid for the first time. Some secrets perhaps best left untold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can make you see things. Visions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visions of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. Damnation. Whatever you're afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Any other `special abilities'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People die around her, is that a special ability?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kills people? 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by her hand, they just die. I had two brothers, Brent and Travis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret's voice falters. Overcome by grief, she dissolve into tears. It's a side of her we've never seen. Human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I mean they was healthy boys, healthy as can be. Eddie, three sisters. Soon as she was born they started dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blame Lucy for their deaths?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret nods yes, wiping her eyes. Embarrassed. Unaccustomed to crying in front of strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you imagine you were spared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess she couldn't get rid of us till she found somebody else. Now that she has, I don't imagine we're long for this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ON MARGARET - face streaked with tears, her pain deep and undeniable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO OF EDWARD SHERIDAN in a violent rage. Pushing his chair back from the interview table, he stands, screaming through clenched teeth, his broken jaw wired shut:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, please calm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of orderlies rush in to restrain him. The CAMERA g knocked ajar in the struggle. The tape ends as they take Edward screaming to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the interview. Emily stares at the BLANK BLUE SCREEN, transfixed, lowers her gaze to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a PHOTO tucked inside the psychiatric file. Edwar and Margaret in happier times - YOUNG BIBLE CAMP COUNSELO in T-shirts and hiking boots on a path through sunlit for Sweet. Innocent. Emily's age. The year they met perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds it up to the newspaper mugshots for a before-an after comparison. The transformation of their faces is shocking. Emily sits frozen by the realization: Edward an Margaret Sheridan. Not criminals. Victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old brick orphanage turned psychiatric hospital. Emily Volvo goes up the winding tree-lined drive.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF PSYCHIATRIST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately Mrs Sheridan suffered a rather severe psychotic episode last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and the CHIEF PSYCHIATRIST walk down a dark, institutional corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Woke up screaming, absolutely convinced she was on fire. She wasn't, of course, they managed to sedate her. But it's curious, she displays all the symptoms of a burn patient. Except the burns themselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret's door. Emily peers through a little square of reinforced glass. A padded cell. Margaret strapped to a bed. Writhing in pain. Laboring to breathe. Eyes swimming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In no condition for visitors as you can see. If you'd like, I could let you see Mr Sheridan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily hesitates, afraid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She casts a departing glance through the window and shudd to see that Margaret's roaming eyes have locked on her in hollow stare. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restrained in a straitjacket, Edward is brought in by two orderlies who seat him at a table opposite Emily and then exit. Jaw wired, everything he says is spoken through clenched teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm probably the last person you want to see right now, but you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His stare unnerves her. She stops and collects herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one I can talk to. Lucy's been staying with me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily falls silent. Her voice cracks with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward nods yup. Regards her in silence. Emily speaks, or tries to, just to fill that awful void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, ummm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, skewered again, nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence. She meets his gaze. And there is eye contac true understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You judged us before you ever walked in that house. Sat there in our living room tellin' us about our problems, how to be better parents - certain of everything and dead wrong about all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask what you came to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment: 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a question Edward has asked himself once or twice. H leans back in his chair and folds his arms with an almost casual air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can tell you what she's not. She not a daughter of mine. She's not a ten-year- old having trouble in school. She's not some innocent victim whose door you busted down and life you saved. And she's not going no place, lady, till she's good and done with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done with me how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However she wants. You think it's an accident her ending up with you? She saw you coming a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me? I don't have anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have that you're good. Kindness. Decency. That's what she feeds on. Bleeds ya dry, moves onto the next. We were a big family, she went through us like a wrecking ball. And you know, every time something happened, every time, we had an excuse for why it wasn't her fault. Cuz it's easier to lie to yourself than think bad things about your baby girl. But finally we got to a point where me and Maggy looked at each other - (remembers so clearly) - where we looked at each other and we was out of lies, both of us. Most terrifying moment of our lives. And that's where you are now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily silently registering this truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you this. She sees everything. And what she doesn't see she just sort of senses it, like when you call a friend and they pick up before it rings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only time you got the upper hand is when she's sleepin' but she almost never does. We checked on her every night for three months. Every twenty minutes, up and down those stairs. First time she slept was the night you kicked in my front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To know... what your idea of hell is... and make you live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits in haunted silence. Edward's features soften.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a hateful man. I look at you and I wish I could tell you you're through the worst of it. That it's gonna work out for you in the end. I wish I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pitying smile reveals Edward's wired teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How strong's your faith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY, the bloated director from the custody panel, walki briskly down a corridor. Emily calls to her from behind, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, I heard about Doug. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy glances at her watch, nods okay, a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and Nancy enter the lavish office. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it working out with the Sheridan girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, that's why I'm here. I appreciate what you did for me, Nancy, I really do, but I think it'd be best if she was placed in foster care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is. You're it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but it's not working out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing mommy isn't the laugh-a-minute you were hoping, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy nods, not entirely surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you petitioned for custody, you got it. She's your responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till we find a suitable foster home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is that going to take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking me questions you know the answer to. Three to six weeks. Surely you can manage that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her anymore. I'm done. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy grimaces. Scary lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you look. I put my reputation, quite possibly my career, on the line for you. Don't embarrass me. You make this work. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I make it work if it's not working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However! Find a way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK stops in an aisle, hands Emily a DEADBOLT from a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off. Emily weighs the deadbolt in hand. Puts it down and picks up the next larger size. Grabs a second on just to be safe. A third for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With urgency Emily removes all her backup files from the shelf in Lucy's room. Dropping them in banker's boxes. Stops on Diego's. Eyes his photo. Drops it in. Grabs the office phone, boxes it with the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily unplugs the phone in the kitchen. Unplugs the one b the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens the closet and tosses the phones inside with the banker's boxes she put there. Closes the door. Locks it. Hides the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a FLASHING RED LIGHT draws her gaze to the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stopping at the end of the block. Emily crosses to the window, watching as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gets off and comes up the sidewalk toward the house. Sens Emily's stare, she stops and meets it. Waves, testing the waters. Emily waves back but it's a hollow gesture. Lucy' smile fades, knowing this as she continues toward the hou 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sudden panic Emily goes into the kitchen, grabs one the knives. Eyes the blade, forced to contemplate the unthinkable - its use as a weapon, self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes into the living room, holding it. Catches sight herself in the mirror. A jarring image:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Emily Jennings with a butcher's knife in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of LUCY'S FOOTSTEPS on the front steps breaks t spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily hides the knife behind the fish tank. No good, you see it through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear LUCY'S KEY IN THE LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily grabs the knife. It's in her hand as the door CLICK open, until the last second when she tosses it under a so pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy enters. Shy. Innocent. A ten-year-old home from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily returns a plastic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't there so I took the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, work - lost track of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I know how busy you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily watches unnerved as Lucy crosses to the sofa, to th very pillow where she hid the butcher's knife, and sits d to untie her shoes. The point of the knife is almost touching her leg. If she moves at all, it will cut the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter anyway, the bus stops right at the end of the street. So I can always get home, whether you're there or not. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods then pauses and looks at the pillow, or appears but she is actually looking at the end table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it wasn't working...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods oh. Finishes untying her shoes then gets up and walks into the kitchen, checks the wall, turns to Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That one, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, caught in a lie, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a shower? We had gym today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily nods. Lucy heads into the bathroom. Pauses at the door, back turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they being nice to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns for Emily's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How - how would I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you were going to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy frowns. A bewilderment that seems genuine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. I must have dreamt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes into the bathroom. Closes the door. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ear pressed to the bathroom door, Emily listens to the RUNNING WATER: Lucy taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the closet, unlocks it. Grabs one of the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like EMILY'S VOICE is coming from the fridge un we sweep past it to see her crouching by a phone jack in corner. Whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, Robin, anywhere. Just find somewhere that will take her. Tonight. I don't want this girl in my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily unplugs the phone. And just then hears a SOFT BREAT behind her. Oh shit. Slowly turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair dripping wet. A chilling stare. How much did she hea Lucy walks out. We hear her bedroom door close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily crouched in the corner, holding the phone, terrifie the thought of what's in store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HEAD OF A TURNING SCREW - Emily installing a DEADBOLT her door in the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the third lock, the other two already in place. Hand trembling, she lines up the last screw. It slips from her fingers. ROLLS UNDER THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cracks opens the door. Reaches to grab it and lets ou SHRIEK, recoiling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing just outside her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands it back to Emily, making no overt acknowledgeme of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks down the hallway to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Lucy's door closes, Emily closes hers and goes back to work, doublespeed. Winds that last screw into the wood and then slides-to the heavy bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooting backwards, she sits against the bed, wide-eyed w terror, screwdriver clutched in her fist like a stabbing weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell TOLLS in a steeple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Emily is going against the tide, walking up t steps past CHURCHGOERS who are coming down after morning mass. Halfway up, she runs into Mike Barron and his wife son. It's awkward, more for her than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on a bench in a park that occupies the shadow of old stone church, Emily and Mike talk privately. His wife pushing his young son on a playground swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `No such thing as a bad kid, only bad parents.' I always believed that. It's a lie. Her parents aren't crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna end up where they did keep talking like this. (off her look) I'm not judging you. You're grieving for Doug and you're still confused about what Diego did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego grew up in a bad home, he saw violence and he repeated it, that's the cycle, you know that better than anyone. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did she lie about calling him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause she's a liar, that doesn't mean she made him do it. Look, let me tell you what Lucy is. Lucy is a damaged child, a deceitful child, a manipulative child. But a damaged, deceitful, manipulative child is not a demon. Ask my brother-in-law, he's got a couple of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron stands from the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, you know I'm not crazy. Don't run away from something just because it scares you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His concern edges toward sadness. He indicates the church

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped you on the steps. I think maybe you oughta go all the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks off to rejoin his wife and son. Emily alone on a be in the shadow of a church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circle of abused children. Lucy among them, a happy participant. Nancy filling in for Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's EMILY'S POV - as she spies on Lucy through the windo second-guessing herself for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Session over, Nancy dismisses the group with a smile and theatrical applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily watches Lucy cross the room. At the coat rack, she whispers something to another girl. The veil of Lucy's ha partially obscures her profile, but through that veil Emi sees something chilling. For a moment, a moment so fleeti it might just be a trick of the eyes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily draws a sharp inward breath. Lucy, feeling Emily's stare now, turns to meet it. Her SWEET INNOCENT GIRL LIPS widening into a smile. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Emily knows what she saw. She throws open the door an rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabs Lucy by the arm and yanks her bodily from the room. This, to the amazement of Nancy, the other children -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and to the shock of the other PARENTS waiting outside. Nancy comes after her in a fury. Runs her down. Erupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are barging in there like that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her in group anymore, I don't want her around the other kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's not your decision, is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily opens her mouth to reply, but Lucy beats her to the punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Nancy, Emily's been under a lot of stress lately, but she's really nice to me and I hope I can stay with her a really long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy, disarmed by the glowing praise, turns back to Emil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk about this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you next week, Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy doesn't hear, busily reassuring parents, damage control. Emily and Lucy arrive at the elevator. Emily hit the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Emily? 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily says nothing. Lucy keeps asking the same question, the exact same intonation, as Emily ignores her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Emily? Why, Emily? Why, Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and Lucy step in. The door closes. Lucy continuing her verbal assault as they start to descend:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Emily? Why, Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the ELEVATOR LURCHES TO A VIOLENT STOP. It buckl Emily's knees. She is terrified, practically hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-w-what's happening - ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy has gotten her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go back to group next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks at her as one regards a small dumb animal. The looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horror as Emily realizes what she's thinking. We hear the first CABLE SNAP above them. In the CREAKING HUSH that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second CABLE SNAPS. The elevator goes into a HELLISH FREE FALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acceleration is dizzying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily clutches the rail with both hands, SCREAMING as the elevator goes cannonballing down the shaft. Lucy indiffer as they plummet toward certain death. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor indicator light races toward L, the car shudder violently, the noise deafening. It's a horrible way to di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily closes her eyes in anticipation of impact. And in t sudden BLACKNESS there's no noise at all. Just a soft,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathless pause then Emily opens her eyes. And sees th elevator is no longer falling. Never was. The doors glide open to the first floor lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gives her a quiet look and strolls out. A businessma steps into the elevator, watching bewildered as Emily releases her white-knuckled grip on the railing and stagg out, so badly shaken she can barely stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish swim languidly in the tank. It's after midnight. We' looking down the darkened hall at Emily's closed bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, in a coat and shoes, packing a suitcase. Snaps it quietly shut. Looks over at the barricaded door. Draws a tense breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From down the hall we hear the DEADBOLTS SLIDE QUIETLY OP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY'S TERRIFIED FACE peers out. Making sure the hall is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps out, suitcase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiptoes down the hall. Quietly as possible as she comes p Lucy's door. It's open a crack. The room pitch black inside. Emily steps closer, breath held. Peers in through the little crack. Sees -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But suddenly her EYES SNAP OPEN. Her face horizontal on t pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily backs away. Goes quickly to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily throws the suitcase in the trunk. Slams it shut. Comes around to the driver's side door. Jumps in. Closes the door. And gets the scare of her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily recoils with a SCREAM, throwing her body against th window behind her. Lucy sits there, silent, betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too much for Emily. She breaks down. Buries her face in her hands and sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, after a moment, takes a brush from Emily's bag and starts lovingly brushing her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily slowly lifts her head, resigning herself to this la horror. She sits zombie-like behind the wheel, tears streaming as Lucy tugs gently at the snarls, playing momm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sad. This is your new beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unopened mail and new case files piling up. Emily looks terrible, phone to ear, getting SCREAMED at, sworn at, interrupted every time she tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Lynch, I told you - will you let - that's not what I said - no, I did not - you never sent me the - Mrs Lynch - will you let me respond? - will you let me - Mrs Lynch - will you let -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily can't take it anymore. She unloads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slams the phone down. Sits there looking rather dazed. Wayne arrives, dazed in a different way, having overheard 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, so, I notice you haven't taken any personal days. Come on, you look like crap, go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily levels a withering stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily knocking on a door in an outside hallway. It opens. It's the girl from the bar. BECCA. The friend. Not expecting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, disheveled, five days without sleep, doing her bes appear rational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I haven't been a great friend lately, but... do you think maybe I could crash here for a couple of nights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight and tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becca draws air through her teeth, pained by her predicam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em, any other weekend you know I'd say yes, but I just met this guy and he's coming over tonight like for the night and it might be, you know, kinda weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily nods. And there's nothing more to be said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stormy night. Heavy rain. High winds. The trees, thrashin outside the window, backlit by a streetlight, cast OMINOU SHADOWS on the walls of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily huddles in the corner, wrapped in a blanket, clutch the screwdriver. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK on the bedroom door. Emily's EYES JERK W OPEN. She looks at the door, but doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Lucy's voice, innocent, afraid -

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Emily...? Can I come in? I'm scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily says nothing. Heart racing. There's another KNOCK. little louder.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Emily? Please? I know you're in there, please...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily says nothing. Lucy starts pounding on the door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Please, Emily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily listening, barely breathing. Is that it? Is she gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then suddenly - WHAM! - WHAM! - WHAM! - the pounding turns VIOLENT, practically shaking the door off its hinge Far too violent for a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily wedges herself into the corner, absolutely petrifie There is something very strong and very angry on the othe side of that door, SHRIEKING in the voice of a child -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM - WHAM - WHAM - WHAM - WHAM - WHAM! The door getting absolutely pummeled, looking like it might splinter from force. And it's so intense that it's almost surreal what Emily is seeing. Lucy's voice eerily monotone, the words coming inhumanly fast like some auctioneer from hell -

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in, let me in... 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relentless. Tormenting Emily. Until she can't take it anymore. And she SCREAMS as loud as she can, half cursing half begging, the veins standing out in her neck -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the POUNDING STOPS DEAD. All we hear is the rain drumming on the roof. And Emily's QUICK TERRIFIED BREATHS she stares at the door wondering what's next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's nothing. Just the shadows dancing on the wall It appears the nightmare is over for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden CLUNK in the closet makes her jump. Her head sna around - what was that? She just stares, unable to breath because whatever she just heard is INSIDE HER ROOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White-knuckled grip on that screwdriver, Emily stands up comes slowly over to the CLOSET DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises the screwdriver. Ready to stab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes hold of the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly turns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PITCH BLACK inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense pause as she stares into that blackness, then rea a hand into the closet, feeling around for the pull-strin Finds it. Gives it a tug. And there, right in front of he is a vision of unspeakable horror:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twitching spasmodically in a hospital gown. HIDEOUSLY BURNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes at Emily arms flailing, clumsy with rage and dementia. Emily leaps aside and Margaret goes careening i the furniture, howling and spinning like some crazed Whir Dervish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily scrambles over the bed. Reaches the door. Fumbles a the deadbolt. Here comes Margaret. At the last second Emi gets the door open. Runs out. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears a path down the dark hallway. Margaret right behind her, hideous, reeling, hitting the walls with her flailin arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily throws open the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashes from the house into the abandoned street. Running the rain. Margaret comes crashing out of the house, chasi her down the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sees a city bus parked up ahead. Makes a run for it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metro transit bus idling along the curb. The DRIVER wit his feet up between shifts, reading a porno mag. Emily co running up to the door. Pounds frantically on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver meets eyes with her through the door. Keeps reading. Unimpressed. More pounding from Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver points to the sign above the door: OUT OF SERV Keeps reading. Emily near hysterics at this point. Margar closing in fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver sighs, weighing his obligations. Emily spins, back to the door. Margaret nearly upon her, ten feet away five, four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver opens the door. Emily dives backwards onto the bus, the door snapping closed in front of her just as Margaret lunges for her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody out there. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There - is - nobody - out - there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sinks in the second time. Emily scans the sidewalk, th darkened streets outside the bus. Margaret is gone. Was never there. The driver opens the door, nods to her - out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a hydraulic HISS the bus releases its brakes and die off down the empty street. Emily stands alone. Rain-soake Shivering. Staring at her house down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SILHOUETTE OF A CHILD in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and his BOYFRIEND shake rain off an umbrella as the cross the darkened office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the office space) No, I like it. It's like those things they put baby cows in to make veal -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boyfriend slows as they go past a cubicle. Saw someth weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points. Freaked. Wayne comes over, pokes his head in a cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: head down on her desk, rain-soaked, sleeping in her chair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply. Wayne's face darkens. Is she dead? He comes over, puts his hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She awakens with a jolt. Expecting to see Margaret. She looks terrible. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus - are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I had some things to catch up on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fumbles unconvincingly at some loose paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like shit, you need to see a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said mind your own fucking business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked by the outburst, by her general appearance, he wa away, muttering to his boyfriend. Emily puts her head in hands, pressing down at her temples. Wayne steps into his office in the b.g. and grabs something then they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the office is quiet again. Emily closes her eyes. Jus then, she hears -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint CYCLICAL SQUEAKING NOISE in the cubicle right nex hers. Goes rigid. Recognizes the sound. Calls over the partition without moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply, but the SQUEAKING CONTINUES. Rising slowly from her seat, scared as hell, she leans over her desk and pee over the partition into the adjacent cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty. But the OFFICE CHAIR IS TURNING as if someone were just playing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily steps slowly back. And now hears the same CYCLICAL SQUEAKING behind her. The opposite row. She spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks slowly from her cubicle. Comes along the row of darkened cubicles, following the sound to its source. Thi is the one. She looks in. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty cubicle. TURNING CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily backs away. Terrified. The chair winding slowly to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, behind her, at the far end of the office, a different NOISE splits the silence. Emily turns and stare toward the sound. The XEROX MACHINE. Someone is using it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily comes slowly down the aisle to the partitioned workstation. A torturous walk set to the RHYTHMIC CADENCE the photocopier, the HARSH GREEN LIGHT SWEEPING ACROSS TH CEILING ABOVE IT, again and again and again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it stops, ejecting one final page as Emily enter the workstation. And sees there's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the idle machine for a moment, then at the STACK OF COPIES lying upsidedown in the tray. She comes over, picks them up. Turns them over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first page is a photocopy of a PAIR OF HANDS PRESSED AGAINST THE COPYING GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stares, haunted. Tense breath. Continues through th stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Successive pages show the same two hands, but leaning for into the inky blackness between them is a FACE, its featu resolving into murky focus as it approaches the glass. Th last page is a horrific image. A man screaming in such terror that his face appears almost deformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's DOUG. The night of his death. Like a snapshot from h bathroom mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily shudders, the stack of pages tumbling to the floor. Runs out. And we see the photocopies, lying on the floor, are totally BLANK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, leaving, rushes down a corridor toward the lobby. Tense. Head on a swivel. Hears MORE SQUEAKING behind her. Spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks on. Turns the corner and RUNS INTO SOMEONE UNEXPECTED. Jumps back with a SHRIEK before she realizes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ponytailed woman in her mid-forties, the child placemen specialist Emily called from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here so late? I tried calling you. I found someone to take Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anaheim couple. They've helped us out before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows Emily a custody form with an attached photo:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily's face darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stares at the unsuspecting family. Lucy's next victims. She fends off a wave of emotion as the full horr of her predicament hits her. Then, matter-of-factly, faci that fear head-on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm keeping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emily walks off, ripping the custody form to shreds, R utterly confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits opposite Edward Sheridan in the visiting room, odd sense of camaraderie between them. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get rid of her, if I put her into the system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts all over again somewhere else. Can't let her stay, can't let her go. That leaves you with one option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye contact. Emily looks away, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Edward, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to. You have to find the strength. Don't you understand? That's why she's doing this. To test you. Test your faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout anger. Got some of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily lowers her gaze to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How... how do I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her? In her sleep, assuming you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what I'd do different. Count myself dead at the outset. Accept that going in and use it to my advantage. That's the one thing I don't think she'd see coming, someone giving up their own life to take hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emily registers this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of the night, the living room is lit by the eerie of the fish tank. The filter humming. The fish swimming languidly. Suddenly they DISPERSE, spooked by something outside the tank. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bureau has been pushed in front of the deadbolted doo form a barricade. Emily lies in a fetal position on her b exhausted but unable to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tenses at the sound of a MUFFLED MALE VOICE in the ot room. Comes over to the door, trying to listen. Thinks sh recognizes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls through door) Mike...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of indecision then Emily tightens her grip on th screwdriver and quietly slides open the deadbolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes slowly down the hall, following the VOICE to it source, stops in the living room doorway, haunted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's psych interview playing to the empty room. He's straightjacketed, sedated. Talking directly to the camera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she now? Some family somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does that concern you, Edward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you have to warn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily turns off the tv. IMMEDIATELY IT SWITCHES ITSELF BA ON. Emily freezes, realizing the room is not empty. Turning, she sees Lucy sitting in the shadows holding the remote. Lucy mutes the sound and returns Emily's stare, thoughtful, almost empathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here. I like you. You want me to like you, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily nods. The room bathed in the tv's flickering blue light. Lucy is quiet for a moment. Then, in her innocentl menacing voice, explains the rules: 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do what I say. If I say I want to go to group, you have to do it. If I say I want a new dress, you have to do it. If I say I want ice cream every day after school, you have to do it. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily gives a haunted nod, remembering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHCUT of Lucy sitting between Edward and Margaret at Child Services meeting, new dress, ribbon in her hair, licking her ice cream with a wicked little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stares coldly at the television: Margaret speaking w the sound off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did what I said for a while and then they stopped and started with the secrets. But they weren't really secrets I guess... (looks at Emily) ...because I always knew what they were thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds Emily's gaze then looks back at the tv. Margare image reflected in the pupils of her eerie unblinking eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret, straps unbuckled, sits on the bed beside a YOUN NURSE who checks her temperature. Done, the Nurse heads o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror in Margaret's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Maggie. I'll check on you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse exits. Locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK-KA-THUNK. The sound of doom to Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up, looking around, trembling at what's to com Her footsteps sound oddly HOLLOW, METALLIC on the floor. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET'S POV - surveying the room, we see what Margaret hell looks like. It's not a room she's living in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With dark scorched metal walls. A bolted-down bed to one side, perfectly white, like a practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear the low HISS of it filling with gas. The fain POOF as it ignites beneath her. The first SHIMMERING WAVE OF HEAT rising up, singeing her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret runs screaming to the door, claws at the pane of glass like a madwoman. But there is no escape from the he of her own mind. The YOUNG NURSE'S FACE APPEARS there in window, shocked by Margaret's insane rantings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, dinner tray in hand, going through the cafeteria with other INSTITUTIONAL PATIENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down at a table and starts eating, quiet, lost in thoughts. Takes another mouthful of food and suddenly sto chewing, noticing something very strange:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his gaze to Edward. Smiles a knowing, taunting smile. Then his WIDE WET MOUTH speaks in a little girl's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy you're getting the help you need, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward goes berserk. Launches himself across the table at the guy, stabbing him in the neck with his fork. Vicious attack. Unprovoked as far as anyone else is concerned. A guard rushes over. Edward turns on him, maniacal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As blood pools around Edward's body, some LUNATIC who witnessed the event starts to applaud. Others join in. It the most excitement they've seen all year. And as the applause spreads through the entire cafeteria... 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily comes down the steps, past the morning paper on the walkway. Stops dead in her tracks. Stunned. Comes back an picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bus stop at the end of the street, Lucy mingles happily with other CHILDREN. She meets Emily's gaze down length of the sidewalk. Smiles and waves goodbye as she g on the school bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily drops the newspaper on Barron's desk. The headline about Edward speaks for itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a different Mike Barron than last we saw. Gone is th quiet assurance. Whatever happened rocked him to the core He closes the door for privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I want you to hear. Came in at two o'clock last night. You might wanna sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits. Barron cues a voicemail message on his phone, plays it over the speaker. After a BEEP we hear it. A SINISTER MALE VOICE, guttural, taunting, the voice of a

dialogues.speaker: SINISTER MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: (mocking his earlier line) `It's hard sometimes to tell the truth, but I know you will `cause you're a good little girl...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years in the trenches, can't make Lieutenant? Hurts, doesn't it? Shakes your faith sometimes. You know why they keep passing you over? Do you, Michael? `Cause you're soft. Soft, soft, soft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIRIOUS LAUGHTER followed by a CLICK and a DIAL TONE. Emily's mouth gapes. After a moment: 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. She called Doug. Took me an extra couple of days to get your cell phone records. That's what she's been using.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim pause. Emily digs through her bag. Reaches the botto No cell phone. Staring into the bag, voice wavering with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's taking me apart, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loses it for a second. Barron sits in front of her on the edge of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna help you get to the bottom of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Edward's photo) He told me I have to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron registers that in silence. Stuns her, and himself, what he says next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily looks at him. Disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him. A godsend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna put Beth and Tim in a hotel. Keep her at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily buttoning her shirt after an exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physically you're fine. How's the stress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sleeping, I was hoping you could give me something. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor writes on her prescription pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take one of these, you'll sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily watches the pen scribble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prescription pill bottle on the passenger seat. Emily, driving home, glances at it with apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-rise hotel in downtown Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron, saying goodbye to his WIFE and SON, sets down the overnight bags they've packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kisses her. Turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musses the boy's hair and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron strides down the corridor, his face reflecting the grim task ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His footsteps echo in the parking structure as he walks a a row of parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint JANGLING SOUND stops him dead in his tracks. He turns and scans the garage behind him. It's quiet, eerily still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues onward, but hears the faint JANGLING SOUND a a moment later. Spins, trying to place it. There it is again. Closer this time. Something moving, hiding, behind the rows of cars over there. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends, trying to get a look under the cars. Can't see anything. Unnerved, he moves on, clicks the button on his keychain remote. The lights flash on his car fifty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he continues toward it they reveal themselves, trodding into view from between the cars, CHOKE-CHAIN COL JANGLING around their necks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle-scarred. Vicious. The dogs from Diego's house. The sit down right in front of Barron's car. It's a surreal moment, a trio of attack dogs sitting at quiet attention, square-jawwed, black-eyed, the kinetic calm before a pred strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron draws his gun. Fires a warning shot over their hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deafeningly loud, it echoes through the garage like a thunderclap. But the dogs don't move, just sit there staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron lowers his gun. It's time to get the hell out of here. He backpedals, making no sudden movements, gun stil trained on the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch him, eyes livening with excitement, one of the back legs twitching in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron quickens his step and that's their cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barron fires an errant shot and takes off running. But he can't match their pace, the deadly trio race along the ro police cruisers, closing the gap with ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last second Barron jumps the partition. The pit bu crash skull-first into the concrete, but continue their pursuit unfazed as Barron takes off up the adjoining ramp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up onto the row of cars and runs across the hood denting the metal. The dogs jump up behind him, relentles in their pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaws snapping at his heels, Barron takes to the car roofs the pitbulls leaping from car to car behind him. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back just in time to see the dogs launch themsel They hit him at chest height, sinking teeth in his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stumbling forward, struggling to keep their jaws from his throat, Barron doesn't see what's coming. The last car. T edge of the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's over the edge before he even understands, flailing h arms for a handhold that doesn't exist. The ground, far below, flies up at him in a rush of acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a sickening THUD and find Barron lying face down the pavement below, blood pooling around him. Clinging to life, he opens his eyes and sees the TRIO OF PIT BULLS SITTING OBEDIENTLY BESIDE HIM, unharmed, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But from a distance we see there is only Barron. Dying al between the parked cars. No dogs anywhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily opens the front door, peers in, trying not to make sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply. She enters. Sees -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMPTY BANKER BOXES strewn in the hall. SCATTERED PAGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end, the light is on in Lucy's bedroom. The do open a crack. A shaft of light spilling out into the darkened hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily comes down the hallway past SCATTERED FILE PAGES. Preliminary reports. Medical records. Personality profiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to Lucy's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezes in the doorway, shocked by what lies before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black eyes. Bloody noses. Bruises. Cuts. Burns. PHOTOS OF ABUSED CHILDREN COVER THE ENTIRE FLOOR. A collage of misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is nowhere to be seen. Emily comes in and starts quickly picking them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucked between the file cabinet and the wall is a CORKBOA Emily pulls it out. It's covered with PHOTOS FROM WORK. COWORKERS. HER KIDS. Two of the photos are turned around. She flips them over in rapid succession. Diego. Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rips all the photos from the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos bunched in her hands, she heads for the door, but hears something that stops her in her tracks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange INTERMITTENT BUZZING NOISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lasts two seconds and stops. She turns around, scans t room. Puts down the stack of photos. There it is again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a housefly trapped against a window, but it's bigger, angrier, and appears to be coming from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the foot of Lucy's bed. Emily crosses to it. The BUZZI STOPS. She bends. Takes hold of a corner. Peels it slowly back to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird. Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily straightens, turns. It's coming from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she approaches it the BUZZING INTENSIFIES, louder, mor agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pauses as she gets there, terrified of what she might fin the bed BUZZING FURIOUSLY FROM WITHIN. Something is trapp under those blankets, waiting for release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily extends a trembling hand, takes hold of the blanket and, slowly, rigid with fear, peels them back to reveal 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible, because the BUZZING IS LOUDER THAN EVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a tense swallow Emily realizes it's coming from lowe deeper within the bed, between the mattress and the box spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips her fingers into the crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And slowly lifts the mattress, the BUZZING GROWING FRIGHTENINGLY LOUD as its source is exposed, something hellish waiting for her as she cranes her neck and look t see what lies below -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vibrating. BZZZZZZZZZT. BZZZZZZZZZZT. On the viewscreen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks it up. Stares at it vibrating in her hand. Presses the TALK button. Brings it to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOW STATIC of an open line. Then, a RASPY MALE VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Emily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this...?

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: It's Wayne, Emily, I just got a call, Mike's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, stunned, barely able to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... he's...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They don't know if he fell or what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily's phone hand drops to her side in shock. From down there, we hear Wayne's voice:

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Emily? Emily, are you okay...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, she lifts it. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangs up. On the brink of emotional collapse. Her only confidante dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
