dialogues.text: Just then she hears BREATHING from behind the open door. Someone or something hiding in that dark corner over ther She crosses to it. Pulls back the door and there sits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: quiet, innocent, chin on her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy says nothing. Emily grabs her by the arm. Yanks her her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Emily slaps her. Hard across the face. Knocks her to the floor. Lucy sits up, lip split. Tastes the blood with her tongue. Hint of a smile. The taste of victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Europa. Ganymede. Io. Callisto. The moons of Jupiter. We got back our astronomy tests today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there on the floor. A++ Well done, Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a LOUD BEEP in the other room. Lucy gets up and walks out. Emily watches as Lucy goes into the kitchen. Takes a bag of popcorn from the microwave. Empties it int bowl. Sits down on the living room sofa and clicks on the remote, watching it like nothing ever happened. Emily wal over and pitches the tv onto the floor. The SCREEN SHATTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, unimpressed, expressionless, takes another handful popcorn. Chews it. CRUNCH. CRUNCH. CRUNCH. Emily swats the bowl from her hands. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flicking bits of popcorn off herself, Lucy stands up from sofa. Her face catches the light from the hallway. Emily shudders at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's features look altered somehow, sharpened. It's subtle, but the overall effect is chilling. THE FACE OF A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't yell at me. My mom and dad used to yell at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily backs away, mortified, takes off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rushes in. Slams the door. Bolts the deadbolts. CLUNK. CLUNK. CLUNK. Moment of panic. Will they hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slides her bureau in front of the door. Shoves her bed in front of the bureau just to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the silence we hear LUCY'S FOOTSTEPS coming down the h toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer, closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing else to block the door with. Emily backs away, trembling as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY'S FOOTSTEPS arrive at the door. A tense silence. The

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Emily... I'm sorry... I didn't mean to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily grabs the screwdriver, clutches it in both hands.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I come in so we can talk and work it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a GENTLE KNOCK on the door. Emily flinches, remembering last time.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Emily...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me! 99.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't be mad. I said I was sorry. I'll brush your hair for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The door shudders from a MAMMOTH IMPACT. Last time, it shook the door, this time it shakes the entire wall. Emily recoils, dropping the screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! CRACKS APPEAR in the door as it bows from the tremendous force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! CRACKS FAN OUT into the plaster around the doorfra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! Half the SCREWS HOLDING THE HINGES fly from the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The DEADBOLTS BENDING from the ungodly pummeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The DEADBOLT SCREWS getting yanked from the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily frozen in terror, watching. Whatever's out there is coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! One of the DOOR HINGES rips clean from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The FIRST DEADBOLT comes flying off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The SECOND DOOR HINGE gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! ANOTHER DEADBOLT flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The DOOR SPLITS down the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! The THIRD DEADBOLT lands on the floor at Emily's f with a METAL THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathless silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the DOOR RATTLES and drops loose from the frame with DEAD WOODEN CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing holding it in place now except the bureau and the bed. And now they both start to SLIDE BACKWARDS as whatev is on the other side starts pushing its way in. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily topples a high bookcase against the door and pushes back with every ounce of strength she can muster, but it' use. The bureau overturns, CRASHES to the floor. Emily's bare feet slide backwards along with the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they stop. The barricade sufficiently breached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, in her panic, makes a hasty decision. She hides un the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOLD LOW on the open door as LUCY'S FEET step into the room, the feet of a child, but the BREATHING we hear soun emphysemic and the VOICE is unquestionably male - harsh, guttural, taunting Emily as it comes for her:

dialogues.speaker: SINISTER MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Emily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide-eyed with terror under the bed, she watches those fe pick their way over the shattered remnants of the barrica

dialogues.speaker: SINISTER MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Emily... We need to learn healthier ways of resolving conflict, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feet step gingerly past the overturned bureau.

dialogues.speaker: SINISTER MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: ...Most families don't even know they have a problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feet stop at the SCREWDRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: SINISTER MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: ...until it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches down and picks it up, a girl's hand, but t fingers as they wrap tightly around the handle look stron and sinewy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feet stand motionless for a moment then turn and come toward the bed, stopping right in front of EMILY'S HORRIF FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause and then, still from Emily's POV, we see Lucy low herself onto her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!! - with shocking force that hand IMPALES THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pause then both hands come into view, palms flat the hardwood, as she leans her head down. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily recoiling in anticipation as the face comes into vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little girl. With a little girl voice to match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, you silly pumpkinhead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, hyperventilating, stares in shock. Lucy reaches he hand in. Emily backs away, wedges herself in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want me to come under there and get you, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, crying now, shakes her head. Lucy, almost sympathetic, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to count to three. One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two... Two and a half...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and three quarters... Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy starts crawling under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily tries to go backwards, but there's nowhere for her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapped, Emily screams. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stops crawling. Folds her arms, sets her chin on the Comfortable here under the bed. Delighting in the questio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you wanted from your mother. I want you to love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay, I will, I will, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy weighs Emily's surrender for a moment. Then, oddly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come tuck me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy slithers out and we see her feet scamper from the ro Emily puts her head down on the floor and cries, covering mouth with her hands so she won't make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHISTLING KETTLE on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, still in tears, takes it from the burner. Dumps SI SLEEPING PILLS from the prescription bottle. Crushes them with the blunt edge of a knife. Stirs them into a cup of Chamomile tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes at a NOISE behind her. Looks tensely over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She adds sugar, continues stirring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the TEA CUP, in Emily's hand, as she comes nervously down the hall to Lucy's room. We can see Lucy i there, waiting for her in bed. Emily, playing the part, dries her eyes and enters. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits down on the bed, hands Lucy the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chamomile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily nods. The face of a loving mother. Lucy brings the cup to her lips, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have it, you look stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have one later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy considers this, nods okay, takes a sip of tea. Emily picks up a brush and brushes Lucy's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's our new beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy takes a few more sips and sets the tea cup on the bedside table. Emily, tucking her in, gives the cup a nervous glance. Did she drink enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever and ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever and ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily kisses her on the forehead. Lucy looks up at her an for a moment she's the little girl Emily met. Innocent, angelic, closing her eyes for sleep. They flutter open on last time. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you if I need you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's eyes shut. Emily, brushing her hair, staring at th HALF-FULL TEA CUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy asleep in bed. Emily watches from the door, wary, expecting Lucy's eyes to snap open any second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't move, dead to the world. Or is it a game? Emi closes the door. Leans against the wall, shaking, contemplating her next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedges a chair under the door handle. Time of the essence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junk-filled. The door lifts to reveal Emily, silhouetted, looking in. Amid the clutter is a lawnmower. Beside it, a big can of GASOLINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stifling sobs as she douses the walls of the house. The hallway, the bathroom, the kitchen, all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIP OF A MATCH strikes flint, ignites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stares at it for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets it fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAMES SCURRY in a shimmering blue-gold sheet across the floor. Climb the walls, the entire house ablaze in a matt of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits and watches as the door to Lucy's bedroom is engulfed. It's an image straight from hell: A YOUNG WOMAN SITTING ON A SOFA IN A HOUSE OF FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fish, frantic in their tank, catch Emily's eye. She g over and grabs the tank. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke swirling past her, she exits the house, locking the front door behind her. She backs away and watches it burn holding her fish tank, the only thing she saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billowing black smoke. The house fully engulfed as fire engines arriving on the scene, sirens wailing. Emily watching with neighbors on the sidewalk as the FIREFIGHTE uncoil their hoses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window to Lucy's bedroom is a bright red square, an inferno. And as Emily stares at it, disbelieving what she done, the figure of a CHILD appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her whole body ablaze. Horrific. She just stands there, arms at her sides, burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now the FIRE MARSHALL crosses to the onlookers. Holl over the noise and commotion:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody get out okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily wavers, not sure what to say. The Fire Marshall see her indecision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This your house?! (she nods yes) Anybody else inside?! (off her hesitation) Ma'am...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily opens her mouth to reply, but sees something behind that closes her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing on the sidewalk in her pajamas. Unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else inside?! Yes or no?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, in shock, shakes her head no. The Fire Marshall rushes off, walkie-talkie squawking. Emily stands frozen Lucy comes through the crowd to her. More dismayed than angry. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Emily's hand. Together they watch the house bur Firelight playing on their faces. The fish bouncing off t glass in the tank at Emily's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue halflight before dawn. Emily and Lucy sit in the Volvo, eyeing the scorched remains of the house. The firecrew stowing equipment. Emily puts the car in drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FISH FLOATING DEAD at the top of the tank in the back seat as Emily drives down the freeway at daybreak. Lucy gazing out dreamily at the sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can find a hotel with a swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily says nothing. Lucy turns and looks at her, thoughtf almost empathetic. She draws up her knees and rests her c on top, levels an appraising stare at Emily like the one leveled at Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sad, isn't it? How it gets passed on. How people do to their own kids what their parents did to them. That's why you got the job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily turns on the radio, full volume, trying to drown ou Lucy's voice. Lucy reaches over and turns it off. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...To prove to yourself you're not like her, that you're not like your mother. Because that scares you. Scares you more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, in mock sentiment, puts her hand on Emily's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you... even if you don't love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily looks at her, gutted. But defiant. Turning her gaze forward, she tightens her grip on the wheel and calmly, resolutely, JAMS THE GAS PEDAL TO THE FLOOR. The acceleration pitches Lucy backwards into her seat. She si up, eyes wide, didn't see this coming. A suicide run. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense smile from Lucy. The tables have turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stares dead ahead, red-lining the tachometer. Lucy flits her eyes skyward. IMMEDIATELY IT DARKENS AND STARTS RAIN. Emily turns on the wipers, speeds on, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily ignores her, going eighty now, weaving through SLOW TRAFFIC THAT FLIES TOWARD THEM OUT OF THE GRAY HAZE. Lucy panicking, changes channels like a tv. Innocent child all a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, stop, Emily, I'll be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily ignores her, beyond apology. And Lucy's face sharpe She points down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the heavy rain we see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily goes for the brake, but reconsiders, seeing the tru for what it is: a test of faith. She welcomes it. Tighten her grip on the wheel and goes full throttle again, right the truck. Lucy shrieks in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you scared?! 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedal to the floor. Inviting the head-on collision. You c see the BIG RIG DRIVER in the cab, wrestling frantically the steering wheel. Lucy bracing herself, screams -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily clenches her teeth in anticipation of impact, of de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the impact never comes. In the blink of an eye the tr is gone. Open road in front of them. It's not raining. Never was. The wipers SQUEAKING on a dry windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sits in silence, her bag of tricks empty. Emily, triumphant, turns to her with a vindictive smile, the speedometer hitting a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clutches Lucy's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily jerks the car off the road, crashing through the guardrail. Trees snapping in half across the hood as they careening through roadside woods and down a steep embankm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car tears through a chainlink fence and leaps off the high embankment into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impacts and sinks with frightening speed. Water rushing i from all sides. Emily shackles Lucy with her arms as the water rises to cover their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare wide-eyed at one another through the water. Ha swirling around their faces as they sink to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though she anticipated this. Or welcomes it. Or knows something Emily does not. And now Emily sees what Lucy se 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND pries open the door and wrestles Lucy from Emily's grasp. Pulls her from the car, swimming to the surface wi her. Emily is left empty-handed, stunned, alone in her watery grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just when her death seems certain, a HAND grabs her b the shoulder and yanks her out the driver's side window..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulances. Patrol cars. Paramedics. Onshore, drying off with a towel, talking to a uniformed officer is the PASSE who saved Lucy's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right through the guardrail, never touched the brakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily goes by on a gurney, semi-conscious, oxygen mask ov her face. Paramedics checking her vitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loaded into the ambulance, she meets the gaze of Lucy who being attended to by a female PARAMEDIC, who puts her arm around Lucy in a maternal gesture, shielding her from the sight of Emily as Emily did of the Sheridans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at her, okay? Just don't even look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods, the innocent victim. Clinging to her protector she watches the ambulance take Emily Jennings away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Lucy wrapped in a blanket sitting beside the female paramedic in an ambulance. Shivering. Wet-hair clinging t her face. Portrait of a child victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A remarkable story of survival this morning as a young girl is pulled from the Los Angeles reservoir in an accident police are calling suspicious... 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSTITUTIONAL PATIENTS watching tv in the psych hospital room. Slouched on the vinyl sofa, watching without comprehension, heavily sedated, Margaret Sheridan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily talking agitatedly to a MAN IN A SUIT who is writin something and not paying attention to her. We only see he face at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where'd they put her? Foster care? Is she with a family? You have to let me talk to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches the pen from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, quietly takes back his pen.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SUIT
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues writing. There's a KNOCK on the door. A BAILIFF pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily stands up from the chair she's been sitting in and see she's wearing an ORANGE LA COUNTY JAIL JUMPSUIT. The man, her public defender, instructs her as they exit:

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SUIT
dialogues.text: Let me do the talking in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks a private road through sunlit forest with a ki RETIRED COUPLE. Temporary guardians who've taken her in f the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I live with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, darling, we're not foster parents, we just help out when the system's full. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll contact us, Lucy, when your placement comes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman puts her arm around her as they walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some nice family that always wanted a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy smiles, shy, innocent, quietly taking in the scenery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two women cross the office after hours, a pudgy middle-ag FOSTER CARE SUPERVISOR and a younger CASEWORKER who is leaving for the day. The office reminds you of Child Services, another tier of the child welfare system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to the thing Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you should. It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I will, I don't know. We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Janey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caseworker exits. The Supervisor comes down the row o cubicles dropping files on desks. Alone. After hours. A thankless profession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lands on some random desk, amid the usual backlog of m and paperwork. A case file like all the others. The name typed on the label:
